description:
Traited class [tvb.simulator.models.epileptorcodim3.EpileptorCodim3SlowMod]

[Saggioetal_2017]Saggio ML, Spiegler A, Bernard C, Jirsa VK.

Fast–Slow Bursters in the Unfolding of a High Codimension Singularity and the Ultra-slow Transitions of Classes. Journal of Mathematical Neuroscience. 2017;7:7. doi:10.1186/s13408-017-0050-8.

subsystems acting at different timescales. For the fast subsystem we use the unfolding of a degenerate Takens-Bogdanov bifucation of codimension 3. The slow subsystem steers the fast one back and forth along these paths leading to bursting behavior. The model is able to produce almost all the classes of bursting predicted for systems with a planar fast subsystem.

of classes c0, c0', c2s, c3s, c4s, c10s, c11s, c2b, c4b, c8b, c14b and c16b as classified by [Saggioetal_2017] Table 2. Through ultra-slow modulation of the path through the parameter space we can switch between different classes of bursters.

arguments.mu1_Ain: The bifurcation parameter mu1 at the initial point at bursting offset.
arguments.mu2_Ain: The bifurcation parameter mu2 at the initial point at bursting offset.
arguments.nu_Ain: The bifurcation parameter nu at the initial point at bursting offset.
arguments.mu1_Bin: The bifurcation parameter mu1 at the initial point at bursting onset.
arguments.mu2_Bin: The bifurcation parameter mu2 at the initial point at bursting onset.
arguments.nu_Bin: The bifurcation parameter nu at the initial point at bursting onset.
arguments.mu1_Aend: The bifurcation parameter mu1 at the initial point at bursting offset.
arguments.mu2_Aend: The bifurcation parameter mu2 at the initial point at bursting offset.
arguments.nu_Aend: The bifurcation parameter nu at the initial point at bursting offset.
arguments.mu1_Bend: The bifurcation parameter mu1 at the initial point at bursting onset.
arguments.mu2_Bend: The bifurcation parameter mu2 at the initial point at bursting onset.
arguments.nu_Bend: The bifurcation parameter nu at the initial point at bursting onset.
arguments.b: Unfolding type of the degenerate Takens-Bogdanov bifurcation, default is a focus type
arguments.cA: Speed of the ultra-slow transition of the initial point
arguments.cB: Speed of the ultra-slow transition of the final point
arguments.dstar: Threshold for the inversion of the slow variable
arguments.Ks: Slow permittivity coupling strength, the default is no coupling
arguments.N: The branch of the resting state, default is 1
arguments.modification: When modification is True, then use the modification to stabilise the system for negative values of dstar. If modification is False, then don't use the modification. The default value is True
